lexUnit.name: expand.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become larger or more extensive.

sentence.text: At Hughes we 're continually expanding the frontiers of technology .
The number of tram passengers expanded rapidly .
It had expanded rapidly .
Investment in this technology has expanded rapidly in the private sector ; there are now over 350 installations and the number is growing .
This figure is expected to expand considerably at main diets .
The market expanded enormously at home , in Europe and in America .
The education system expanded at all levels .
London expanded at a remarkable rate .
During the period 1990-90 , urban areas expanded at the rate of 11,000 ha per year .
And the policy is bearing fruit : India 's economy will probably expand by more than 5% this year and inflation is down to 7% .
Business investment rose 11% , while world trade expanded by 9.3 the fastest this decade .
Strong words when you consider the market in cholesterol-lowering drugs has expanded by 34.4 per cent a year for the last five years .
In the same time the army of managers expanded from 700 to 13,200 , the Health Department said .
The Russian railway lines expanded greatly from 660 miles in 1850 to 40,194 , principally because of the construction of the Trans-Siberian Railway .
It expanded from 47,000 people in 1841 to 102,000 in 1901 and in 1860 nearly 150,000 people came to the town by excursion train in two successive days .
Instead of the doctors and nurses we so urgently need , we have an army of bureaucrats which has expanded from 700 to 13,200 in the same time .
Existing industries expanded in leaps and bounds .
Managers , technicians , and other ` lower professionals " expanded in number with especial rapidity .
At secondary level , such work can expand naturally into the exploration of dramatic texts .
Cache sizes will expand to 1Mb per processor with the next generation of memory chips .
It should expand to 50-60 by the end of the year .
The universe would expand to a very large size and eventually it would collapse again into what looks like a singularity in real time .
As budgets contract , appetites are expanding for old favourites such as oxtail soup and casseroles .
Lime burning had expanded considerably at Halling in the second half of the eighteenth century .
The cloth trade expanded up to around 1830 .
During the early 1920s the Italian economy expanded dramatically , and by 1931 Milan had more than a million inhabitants , a formidable industrial power base .
Agriculture also expanded hugely .
During the High Middle Ages , many of these towns were successful and soon expanded .
